B1 [ C or U ] the money that is used in a particular country at a particular time: foreign currency
More examplesFewer examplesTake some foreign currency to cover incidentals like the taxi fare to your hotel.Five people were indicted for making and selling counterfeit currency.The Central Bank intervened in the currency markets today to try to stabilize the exchange rate.The currency has lost so much of its value that barter has become the preferred way of doing business.In 1971, Britain switched over to a decimal currency.
